page.title: 14Penryn's Clubs
page.content: For the amount of people in{Penryn there are quite a lot of facilities in the{D-block.}The bowling green of {Penryn}is over looking the harbour at the top of{Quay Hill.}This club has competitions and it also welcomes visitors. At{Kernick Road}the towns cricket club has its place.St Gluvias cricket club was founded in{1950},the present ground at{Kernick Road}was opened in{1970.}Next to this is the{ { Football Association Clubs}ground. {Kernick Road}also has the home of the famous{Penryn Rugby Football} club which is well known wherever the game is played.{Penryn Rugby Football} club was formed in{1872}and is still going strongly in{1985.}It is the oldest such club in Cornwall.
